intro: Corydalis taliensis var. potentillifolia, commonly known as the Tibetan Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of Tibet. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, often pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves, and it produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in spring. Due to its unique habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
